Class Simfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simfile

  • public class Simfile
extends java.lang.Object
    Short for simulation file. Reads, parses, and stores data for .csm files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String filename
      The filename of the simfile being accessed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simfile(java.lang.String filename, double globaloffset)
      Create a Simfile object, given a simfile filename (.csm) and an offset in seconds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String Artist()
      Returns the artist of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile.
      java.lang.String AudioFile()
      Returns the audio file as a String, which is specified in the simfile.
      double[][] BPM()
      Returns the BPM (beats per minute) of the song as a two-dimensional double array, which is specified in the simfile.
      java.lang.String Genre()
      Returns the genre of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile.
      int NoteCount()
      Returns the number of notes in the song's simfile as an integer.
      java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> Notes()
      Returns the notes (arrows) of the song as a mutable two-dimensional list of Strings, which are specified in the simfile.
      java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> NotesTime()
      Returns the notes (arrows) of the song along with the times they should occur within the song in seconds These are returned as a mutable two-dimensional list of Strings, and are specified in the simfile.
      double Offset()
      Returns the offset (delay) of the song in seconds as an integer, which is specified in the simfile.
      java.lang.String Subtitle()
      Returns the subtitle of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile.
      java.lang.String Title()
      Returns the title (name) of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile.
      int Year()
      Returns the year of the song as an integer, which is specified in the simfile.

    • Field Detail

      • filename

        public java.lang.String filename
        The filename of the simfile being accessed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simfile

        public Simfile(java.lang.String filename,
               double globaloffset)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a Simfile object, given a simfile filename (.csm) and an offset in seconds. The offset should only be 0.0 unless the game starts too slow or too fast on every song.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename of the .csm file
        globaloffset - The number of milliseconds to offset the reading of the file by
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws a FileNotFoundException in case the .csm is not found

    • Method Detail

      • Title

        public java.lang.String Title()
        Returns the title (name) of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile. If there is no title specified, it will return "none".
        Returns:
        The title of the song

      • Subtitle

        public java.lang.String Subtitle()
        Returns the subtitle of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile. This may contain relevant information that may not be in the actual song title. If there is no subtitle specified, it will return "none".
        Returns:
        The subtitle for the song

      • Artist

        public java.lang.String Artist()
        Returns the artist of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile. If there is no artist specified, it will return "none".
        Returns:
        The name of the artist

      • Genre

        public java.lang.String Genre()
        Returns the genre of the song as a String, which is specified in the simfile. If there is no genre specified, it will return "none".
        Returns:
        The genre(s) of the song

      • Year

        public int Year()
        Returns the year of the song as an integer, which is specified in the simfile. If there is no year specified, it will return 0.
        Returns:
        The year the song was released

      • AudioFile

        public java.lang.String AudioFile()
        Returns the audio file as a String, which is specified in the simfile. If there is no audio file specified, it will return "none".
        Returns:
        The name of the .wav file that this Simfile corresponds to

      • BPM

        public double[][] BPM()
        Returns the BPM (beats per minute) of the song as a two-dimensional double array, which is specified in the simfile. The number of beats into the song is the first double in each array, followed by the actual BPM. If there is no BPM specified, it will return a blank array.
        Returns:
        A 2D array consisting of all BPMs (and changes if any) and their position in the song

      • Offset

        public double Offset()
        Returns the offset (delay) of the song in seconds as an integer, which is specified in the simfile. If there is no offset specified, it will return 0.
        Returns:
        The amount of seconds that the song should be offset by

      • Notes

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> Notes()
        Returns the notes (arrows) of the song as a mutable two-dimensional list of Strings, which are specified in the simfile. The strings consist of four zeroes and ones, with the numbers corresponding to left, down, up, and right respectively. For example, 0100 is up, and 0001 is right. Each list of strings inside the main list is split by beat, meaning that if there are 8 strings in an array, the notes are split into 1/8 beats. If there are no notes in the simfile, a blank array will be returned.
        Returns:
        A 2D list of all notes in the song

      • NoteCount

        public int NoteCount()
        Returns the number of notes in the song's simfile as an integer.
        Returns:
        The number of total notes in the song

      • NotesTime

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> NotesTime()
        Returns the notes (arrows) of the song along with the times they should occur within the song in seconds These are returned as a mutable two-dimensional list of Strings, and are specified in the simfile. The strings are the same as the Notes() function for arrows, and the times are doubles converted into String objects. If there are no notes in the simfile, a blank array will be returned.
        Returns:
        A 2D list of which notes should occur in each measure
